Comment:
Hi everyone!

This is the third game in the sacrifices theme.  This is a team game.  I got paired up against an opponent nearly 40 points north of my rating.  All seemed lost in the middlegame when I blundered a pawn due to a tactical oversight.  I think this is the only the second time on gameknot I have blundered a pawn to a higher rated opponent and lived to tell the tale, the other was my first ever Master Draw.  So how did all this happen, well read on.
1. ...... d5 - in response to e4 Jiri plays d5 which is the Centre Counter or the Scandinavian Defense.

3. ..... Nxd5 - sometimes the advanced d pawn drops off directly with Qxd5 but then the queen can be a target in the centre in the opening.  However, it is playable and the queen usually lands on a5.  Jiri decided that it was more prudent to develop a knight.

3. ..... Nxd5 - sometimes the advanced d pawn drops off directly with Qxd5 but then the queen can be a target in the centre in the opening.  However, it is playable and the queen usually lands on a5.  Jiri decided that it was more prudent to develop a knight.

20. fxe3 - after the N for B trade Fou Leblanc and a pawn on e3 will be attacked by the Wicked Witch next move and so I must yield my e3 pawn.

25. Bxb7 - a lot has happened over the past 4 moves.  Firstly the queens have been traded and now one pair of rooks.  Fou Leblanc now busts up Jiri's queenside but I must worry about that 4 - 2 kingside majority that Jiri has.  He already has a passer on the e column.
